root.name: set()

example.code: PVector v def setup(): size(100, 100) v = PVector(0.0, 0.0, 0.0) v.set(20.0, 30.0, 40.0) println(v.x)# Prints "20.0" println(v.y)# Prints "30.0" println(v.z)# Prints "40.0"
PVector v1, v2 def setup(): size(100, 100) v1 = PVector(20.0, 30.0, 40.0) v2 = PVector(0.0, 0.0, 0.0) v2.set(v1) println(v2.x)# Prints "20.0" println(v2.y)# Prints "30.0" println(v2.z)# Prints "40.0"
PVector v float[] vvv = 20.0, 30.0, 40.0 def setup(): size(100, 100) v = PVector(0.0, 0.0, 0.0) v.set(vvv) println(v.x)# Prints "20.0" println(v.y)# Prints "30.0" println(v.z)# Prints "40.0"

root.description: Sets the x, y, and z component of the vector using three separate variables, the data from a PVector, or the values from a float array.
